trans-unit.source: Represents a claim for a SAML security token that asserts the subject's name.
Use the SamlNameIdentifierClaimResource class to create a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim> instance for a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> subject name claim.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim> class has a constructor that takes a resource, which this class can be passed to.
<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security tokens specify their claims using SAML assertions, which can specify the subject of the security token.
The claims in a SAML assertion are represented by SAML statements.
The SAML specification defines a set of SAML statement types and one of them is a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubjectStatement>.
A <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubjectStatement> asserts the principal that is the subject of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security token.
This principal is specified using a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject> class.
The SamlNameIdentifierClaimResource class represents the name identifier for a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject>.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlNameIdentifierClaimResource"></xref> class using the specified name, the domain in which the name resides, and the format the name is in.
Although the format used to specify a name is extensible, the following table lists the formats defined by the SAML specification.

|Format|Description| |------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.EmailNamespace%2A>|A URI that states the subject of a SAML assertion is specified as an email address.| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.UserNameNamespace%2A>|A URI that states the subject of a SAML assertion is specified using a Windows domain account.|
The subject name.
Sets the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.Name*> property.
The domain in which the `name` parameter resides.
Sets the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlNameIdentifierClaimResource.NameQualifier*> property.
A URI reference that represents the format that the `name` parameter is in.
Sets the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlNameIdentifierClaimResource.Format*> property.
name is or is .
Returns a value that indicates whether the instance is equal to the specified object.
An object to compare to this instance.
if obj is a and has the same value as this instance; otherwise, .
Gets a URI reference that represents the format that the subject name of a SAML security token is in.
The Format property specifies the format that the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlNameIdentifierClaimResource.Name%2A> property is in.
Although the format used to specify a name is extensible, the following table lists the formats defined by the SAML specification.

|Format|Description| |------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.EmailNamespace%2A>|A URI that states the subject of a SAML assertion is specified as an email address.| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.UserNameNamespace%2A>|A URI that states the subject of a SAML assertion is specified using a Windows domain account.| The Format property corresponds to the `Format` attribute of the `<saml:NameIdentifier>` element that is defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) specification.
A URI reference that represents the format that the subject name of a SAML security token is in.
Returns the hash code for the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlNameIdentifierClaimResource"></xref>.
A hash code for the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlNameIdentifierClaimResource"></xref>.
Gets the subject name of a SAML security token.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlNameIdentifierClaimResource.Format%2A> property specifies the format that the Name property is in and the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlNameIdentifierClaimResource.NameQualifier%2A> property specifies the domain in which the Name property resides in.

The Name property corresponds to the `Format` attribute of the `<saml:NameIdentifier>` element that is defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) specification.
The subject name of a <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken"></xref> security token.
Gets the domain in which the subject name of a SAML security token resides in.
The NameQualifier property specifies the domain in which the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlNameIdentifierClaimResource.Name%2A> property resides in.

The NameQualifier property corresponds to the `NameQualifier` attribute of the `<saml:NameIdentifier>` element that is defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) specification.
The domain in which the subject name of a SAML security token resides in.
